titleStmt.title: James W. Ray et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11039

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency B. Magoffin Governor of Kentucky,

The undersigned citizens of Garrard County, respectfully represent that James Duddleson is now confined in the Penitentiary of this state -- and they believe unjustly confined -- & that the Judgment & verdict of the Jury in the case was erroneous -- That he is a man with wife and two young children who have no means of support, and look to him and his labor only for it, and are with out property & means of support & Kneed his labor & assistance for support & for bread, -- they testify that he has always been a man of good moral character & a law abiding citizen, and never until his trail in the Mercer Court was he charged with any office, -- but has always been esteemed as a good citizen, we pray that your Exlc will pardon him, and restore him to his family -- December 8th 1861 --

James N Ray
William A Wilson
Michael Ray Junier
Abraham Babor
Joseph Ray
James Ward
Richard A. Runyon
William Brother
Isaiah Layne
Sher Shor Sherod Layne
Lawrence Layne
Joseph East
